qas.question: How long is the Greek railway system?
A current railway upgrade plans to do what?
A new modern rail connection has been made between which two cities?

context: Railway connections play a somewhat lesser role in Greece than in many other European countries, but they too have also been expanded, with new suburban/commuter rail connections, serviced by Proastiakos around Athens, towards its airport, Kiato and Chalkida; around Thessaloniki, towards the cities of Larissa and Edessa; and around Patras. A modern intercity rail connection between <a2_0>Athens and Thessaloniki<a2_0/> has also been established, while an upgrade to <a1_0>double lines<a1_0/> in many parts of the 2,500 km (<a0_0>1,600 mi<a0_0/>) network is underway. International railway lines connect Greek cities with the rest of Europe, the Balkans and Turkey.
